intro: Pleurothallis attenuata, commonly known as the slender pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant has a compact growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves that help it thrive in shaded, humid environments. It is often found growing epiphytically on trees in the understory of rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a sought-after plant among orchid enthusiasts.
